newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London firm, Honda buying seen.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London firm, Honda buying seen.

text.p: Japanese shares in London firmed in London amid some buying in some Japanese exporters and car maker Honda Corp.
The Nikkei/ISE 50 index was up 6.59 points, or 0.41 percent, at 1,603.41 by 1545 GMT.
Earlier in Tokyo the Nikkei average was weighed down 122.31 points or 0.60 percent to 20,385.54 as a broker scandal took its toll.
"Japan is looking at Denver (G7 summit June 20-22). So it was a cautious trading day", one trader said.
"There were some bigger blocks in Honda", he added, which had caused the stock to rebound as recent losses were considered overdone.
Honda was up at 3,285 yen, compared with a close of 3,210 yen in Tokyo.
Among others, Fujitsu was up 15 yen to 1565 yen in London, but down on its Tokyo close of 1,570 yen.
Canon was also actively traded, dealers said. The stock was up 22.50 yen to 3,065 yen, up from a close of 3,060 yen in Tokyo.
